back_cards.definition_en: Being the first or earliest form of something.
back_cards.example_en: The original plan was to meet at the park.

back_cards.definition_en: Creative and not copied from someone else.
back_cards.example_en: Her original story won the writing contest.

back_cards.definition_en: Referring to the source or starting point.
back_cards.example_en: The museum displays the original manuscript of the novel.

back_cards.definition_en: Unique or authentic in style or character.
back_cards.example_en: This restaurant serves original recipes from the 19th century.

back_cards.definition_en: Not altered or modified from its first state.
back_cards.example_en: The original design of the building is still intact.

back_cards.definition_en: A person harmed or injured by a crime or accident.
back_cards.example_en: The victim of the robbery reported the incident to the police.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone who suffers from a harmful event.
back_cards.example_en: Flood victims received aid from the community.

back_cards.definition_en: A person negatively affected by a situation.
back_cards.example_en: She was a victim of unfair treatment at work.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone who falls prey to a scam or deceit.
back_cards.example_en: The elderly man was a victim of a phone scam.

back_cards.definition_en: A person sacrificed or affected in a broader context.
back_cards.example_en: Many soldiers were victims of the war.

back_cards.definition_en: A serious disease caused by uncontrolled cell growth.
back_cards.example_en: She is undergoing treatment for breast cancer.

back_cards.definition_en: A harmful influence that spreads destructively.
back_cards.example_en: Corruption is a cancer in the organization.

back_cards.definition_en: A medical condition requiring specialized care.
back_cards.example_en: The hospital opened a new cancer research center.

back_cards.definition_en: A term for a group of related diseases.
back_cards.example_en: Lung cancer is often linked to smoking.

back_cards.definition_en: Something that causes widespread harm metaphorically.
back_cards.example_en: Fake news can be a cancer to public trust.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of speaking or expressing thoughts aloud.
back_cards.example_en: His speech at the conference inspired everyone.

back_cards.definition_en: A formal address or presentation to an audience.
back_cards.example_en: The president delivered a speech on national unity.

back_cards.definition_en: The ability to speak or communicate verbally.
back_cards.example_en: After the accident, she regained her speech slowly.

back_cards.definition_en: A manner or style of speaking.
back_cards.example_en: Her speech was clear and confident during the debate.

back_cards.definition_en: Language or dialect used by a group.
back_cards.example_en: The speech of the region includes unique phrases.

back_cards.definition_en: Specific or distinct from others.
back_cards.example_en: She chose a particular dress for the party.

back_cards.definition_en: Fussy or careful about details.
back_cards.example_en: He is very particular about how his coffee is made.

back_cards.definition_en: Referring to one specific thing or person.
back_cards.example_en: This book is aimed at a particular audience.

back_cards.definition_en: Unusual or noteworthy in some way.
back_cards.example_en: The painting has a particular charm.

back_cards.definition_en: Emphasizing a single item or case.
back_cards.example_en: I have no particular plans for the weekend.

back_cards.definition_en: A legal process in a court to determine guilt or innocence.
back_cards.example_en: The trial lasted for three weeks.

back_cards.definition_en: A test or experiment to evaluate something.
back_cards.example_en: The new drug is undergoing a clinical trial.

back_cards.definition_en: A difficult experience or challenge.
back_cards.example_en: Moving abroad was a trial for the family.

back_cards.definition_en: An attempt to try something new.
back_cards.example_en: Her first trial at baking bread was a success.

back_cards.definition_en: A preliminary competition or test.
back_cards.example_en: He qualified for the team after the trial match.

back_cards.definition_en: Not any of a group or amount.
back_cards.example_en: None of the cookies were left after the party.

back_cards.definition_en: No one or nobody in a group.
back_cards.example_en: None of the students knew the answer.

back_cards.definition_en: Nothing at all.
back_cards.example_en: She had none of the skills required for the job.

back_cards.definition_en: Not even a small amount.
back_cards.example_en: None of the rain reached the dry fields.

back_cards.definition_en: No part or share of something.
back_cards.example_en: He wanted none of the credit for the project.

back_cards.definition_en: A single object or thing.
back_cards.example_en: She picked up an item from the shelf.

back_cards.definition_en: A piece of news or information.
back_cards.example_en: The newspaper published an item about the event.

back_cards.definition_en: An entry on a list or inventory.
back_cards.example_en: Check the next item on your to-do list.

back_cards.definition_en: A product for sale in a store.
back_cards.example_en: This item is on discount this week.

back_cards.definition_en: A topic or subject discussed.
back_cards.example_en: The meeting’s first item was budget approval.

back_cards.definition_en: The measure of how heavy something is.
back_cards.example_en: The package’s weight was over ten pounds.

back_cards.definition_en: Importance or influence of something.
back_cards.example_en: Her opinion carries a lot of weight in the team.

back_cards.definition_en: A heavy object used for exercise.
back_cards.example_en: He lifted a weight at the gym.

back_cards.definition_en: A burden or responsibility.
back_cards.example_en: The weight of the decision stressed her out.

back_cards.definition_en: A unit or system of measurement.
back_cards.example_en: The recipe uses weight instead of volume.

back_cards.definition_en: The day after today.
back_cards.example_en: We have a meeting scheduled for tomorrow.

back_cards.definition_en: The near future.
back_cards.example_en: Tomorrow holds new opportunities for growth.

back_cards.definition_en: A time for planning or action.
back_cards.example_en: Let’s save that task for tomorrow.

back_cards.definition_en: A symbol of hope or change.
back_cards.example_en: Tomorrow will be a better day.

back_cards.definition_en: A deadline or expectation.
back_cards.example_en: The project is due tomorrow morning.

back_cards.definition_en: A single movement of the foot when walking.
back_cards.example_en: She took a step toward the door.

back_cards.definition_en: A stage or part of a process.
back_cards.example_en: The first step is to gather all materials.

back_cards.definition_en: A short distance.
back_cards.example_en: The store is just a few steps away.

back_cards.definition_en: An action taken to achieve a goal.
back_cards.example_en: Moving to the city was a big step for her.

back_cards.definition_en: A level or platform, like on stairs.
back_cards.example_en: He tripped on the top step.

back_cards.definition_en: Showing optimism or confidence.
back_cards.example_en: She has a positive attitude about the future.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicating agreement or affirmation.
back_cards.example_en: He gave a positive response to the proposal.

back_cards.definition_en: Having a good or beneficial effect.
back_cards.example_en: The feedback had a positive impact on her work.

back_cards.definition_en: Certain or definite about something.
back_cards.example_en: I’m positive I locked the door.

back_cards.definition_en: Related to a scientific or medical test result.
back_cards.example_en: The test came back positive for allergies.

back_cards.definition_en: A document with spaces to fill in information.
back_cards.example_en: Please complete the application form.

back_cards.definition_en: The shape or structure of something.
back_cards.example_en: The sculpture has an unusual form.

back_cards.definition_en: A type or kind of something.
back_cards.example_en: This is a rare form of the disease.

back_cards.definition_en: A way something exists or appears.
back_cards.example_en: Water can take the form of ice or steam.

back_cards.definition_en: Condition or readiness, often in sports.
back_cards.example_en: The athlete is in top form this season.

back_cards.definition_en: A legally recognized member of a country.
back_cards.example_en: She became a citizen after passing the test.

back_cards.definition_en: A resident of a city or town.
back_cards.example_en: The citizens of the town voted for a new mayor.

back_cards.definition_en: A person with rights and duties in a society.
back_cards.example_en: Every citizen has the right to free speech.

back_cards.definition_en: An active participant in a community.
back_cards.example_en: He’s a model citizen who volunteers regularly.

back_cards.definition_en: A civilian, as opposed to a soldier or official.
back_cards.example_en: The law protects citizens during wartime.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of learning or examining something carefully.
back_cards.example_en: Her study of biology took years.

back_cards.definition_en: A detailed investigation or research project.
back_cards.example_en: The study revealed new facts about climate change.

back_cards.definition_en: A room used for reading or working.
back_cards.example_en: He retreated to his study to write.

back_cards.definition_en: A piece of academic work or analysis.
back_cards.example_en: Her study on history won an award.

back_cards.definition_en: Preparation for a test or exam.
back_cards.example_en: Late-night study helped her pass the test.

back_cards.definition_en: A journey or travel to a place.
back_cards.example_en: We planned a trip to the mountains.

back_cards.definition_en: A short outing or excursion.
back_cards.example_en: The class went on a trip to the museum.

back_cards.definition_en: An act of stumbling or falling.
back_cards.example_en: She had a trip on the uneven path.

back_cards.definition_en: A period of experiencing something unusual.
back_cards.example_en: The concert was a real trip for the fans.

back_cards.definition_en: A vacation or adventure.
back_cards.example_en: Their trip to Europe lasted two weeks.

back_cards.definition_en: To set up or create something permanent.
back_cards.example_en: They plan to establish a new business.

back_cards.definition_en: To prove or confirm something as true.
back_cards.example_en: The evidence helped establish his innocence.

back_cards.definition_en: To start or initiate a relationship or system.
back_cards.example_en: The company established ties with local suppliers.

back_cards.definition_en: To make something recognized or accepted.
back_cards.example_en: She worked hard to establish her reputation.

back_cards.definition_en: To settle or install in a place or role.
back_cards.example_en: He established himself as a leader in the field.

back_cards.definition_en: A senior manager or leader in an organization.
back_cards.example_en: The executive made key decisions for the company.

back_cards.definition_en: A person with high-level administrative authority.
back_cards.example_en: She’s an executive at a tech firm.

back_cards.definition_en: The branch of government responsible for enforcing laws.
back_cards.example_en: The executive signed the new policy into law.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone directing a specific project or division.
back_cards.example_en: The marketing executive launched the campaign.

back_cards.definition_en: A role with strategic decision-making power.
back_cards.example_en: He aspired to become a corporate executive.

back_cards.definition_en: The activities involved in governing a country.
back_cards.example_en: She’s deeply involved in local politics.

back_cards.definition_en: The study or practice of political systems.
back_cards.example_en: He majored in politics at university.

back_cards.definition_en: Interactions involving power or influence in a group.
back_cards.example_en: Office politics can be challenging to navigate.

back_cards.definition_en: Debates or conflicts over policies or beliefs.
back_cards.example_en: The dinner turned into a discussion of politics.

back_cards.definition_en: Strategies to achieve goals in a competitive environment.
back_cards.example_en: The politics of the deal required careful negotiation.

back_cards.definition_en: A thin piece of wood or similar material.
back_cards.example_en: The dog fetched the stick from the yard.

back_cards.definition_en: A tool or object shaped like a stick.
back_cards.example_en: She stirred the soup with a wooden stick.

back_cards.definition_en: A small, thin item, like for eating or applying.
back_cards.example_en: He ate the ice cream with a stick.

back_cards.definition_en: A remote or rural area, often plural.
back_cards.example_en: They live out in the sticks.

back_cards.definition_en: A piece of equipment in sports, like hockey.
back_cards.example_en: The player broke his stick during the game.
